DataElement.preferredName: Index Lesion Response irRC Measurable Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent the overall disease response in the largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy using the  Immune-Related Response Criteria (irRC) criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy._Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The largest tumor lesion targeted by therapy.

Concepts.definition: The most clinically significant tumor lesion targeted by therapy. The lesion is typically the largest or highest graded of the tumor foci detected.

Property.preferredDefinition: Response is any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/2/18 jk created for DCI study and iRECIST FG activity.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A set of response criteria designed to capture additional response patterns observed with immune therapy beyond those described by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) or WHO criteria._Capable of being measured._An assessment of the overall response of the disease to the therapy._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Complete disappearance of all lesions (whether measurable or not, and no new lesions); confirmation by a repeat, consecutive assessment no less than 4 weeks from the date first documented.

Concepts.definition: Complete disappearance of all lesions (whether measurable or not, and no new lesions); confirmation by a repeat, consecutive assessment no less than 4 weeks from the date first documented.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Increase in tumor burden greater than or equal to 25 percent relative to nadir (minimum recorded tumor burden); confirmation by a repeat, consecutive assessment no less than 4 weeks from the date first documented.

Concepts.definition: Increase in tumor burden greater than or equal to 25 percent relative to nadir (minimum recorded tumor burden); confirmation by a repeat, consecutive assessment no less than 4 weeks from the date first documented.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Decrease in tumor burden greater than or equal to 50 percent relative to baseline confirmed by a consecutive assessment at least 4 weeks after first documentation.

Concepts.definition: Decrease in tumor burden greater than or equal to 50 percent relative to baseline confirmed by a consecutive assessment at least 4 weeks after first documentation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not meeting criteria for irCR or irPR, in absence of irPD.

Concepts.definition: Not meeting criteria for irCR or irPR, in absence of irPD.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Immune-Related Response Criteria Measurable Overall Response Category
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A set of response criteria designed to capture additional response patterns observed with immune therapy beyond those described by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) or WHO criteria.:Capable of being measured.:An assessment of the overall response of the disease to the therapy.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: A set of response criteria designed to capture additional response patterns observed with immune therapy beyond those described by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) or WHO criteria.
An assessment of the overall response of the disease to the therapy.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/23/18 jk chg reg status to Standard for RECIST defined PV list; do not add PVs without checking latest version of guideline.  4/5/18 jk created for DCI study and immune RECIST FG activities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: irRC instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: CDE captures the overall response of all Index lesions response.  Use CDE 6160058 to collect  individual Index lesion responses (log line).

DataElement.changeDescription: 10-22-18 Registration status changed to Standard/TMT. 10/19/18 jk removed dup terms in LN. 4/5/18 jk created for DCI study and immune RECIST FG activities.
